burial.n.01.definition: the ritual placing of a corpse in a grave

arbitrage.n.01.definition: a kind of hedged investment meant to capture slight differences in price; when there is a difference in the price of something on two different markets the arbitrageur simultaneously buys at the lower price and sells at the higher price

banking.n.01.definition: engaging in the business of keeping money for savings and checking accounts or for exchange or for issuing loans and credit etc.

boondoggle.n.01.definition: work of little or no value done merely to look busy

slavery.n.03.definition: work done under harsh conditions for little or no pay

carpentry.n.01.definition: the craft of a carpenter: making things out of wood

bookkeeping.n.01.definition: the activity of recording business transactions

trading.n.01.definition: buying or selling securities or commodities

electioneering.n.01.definition: persuasion of voters in a political campaign

campaigning.n.01.definition: the campaign of a candidate to be elected

farming.n.02.definition: agriculture considered as an occupation or way of life

sitting.n.01.definition: (photography) the act of assuming a certain position (as for a photograph or portrait)

quarterback.n.02.definition: (American football) the position of the football player in the backfield who directs the offensive play of his team

specialization.n.02.definition: the special line of work you have adopted as your career

elision.n.01.definition: omission of a sound between two words (usually a vowel and the end of one word or the beginning of the next)

escape.n.04.definition: an avoidance of danger or difficulty

miss.n.02.definition: a failure to hit (or meet or find etc)

dispensation.n.01.definition: an exemption from some rule or obligation

challenge.n.04.definition: a formal objection to the selection of a particular person as a juror

demur.n.01.definition: (law) a formal objection to an opponent's pleadings

disappointment.n.02.definition: an act (or failure to act) that disappoints someone

backfire.n.04.definition: a miscalculation that recoils on its maker

backlash.n.02.definition: an adverse reaction to some political or social occurrence

wince.n.02.definition: a reflex response to sudden pain

pullback.n.02.definition: (military) the act of pulling back (especially an orderly withdrawal of troops)

ebb.n.02.definition: the outward flow of the tide

emanation.n.03.definition: (theology) the origination of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost

legal_separation.n.02.definition: (law) the cessation of cohabitation of man and wife (either by mutual agreement or under a court order)

schism.n.01.definition: division of a group into opposing factions

rupture.n.02.definition: a personal or social separation (as between opposing factions)

breakaway.n.01.definition: the act of breaking away or withdrawing from

dissociation.n.01.definition: the act of removing from association

disunion.n.01.definition: the termination or destruction of union

divorce.n.01.definition: the legal dissolution of a marriage

division.n.11.definition: an arithmetic operation that is the inverse of multiplication; the quotient of two numbers is computed

gerrymander.n.01.definition: an act of gerrymandering (dividing a voting area so as to give your own party an unfair advantage)

stratification.n.01.definition: the act or process or arranging persons into classes or social strata

tightening.n.01.definition: the act of making something tighter

addiction.n.03.definition: (Roman law) a formal award by a magistrate of a thing or person to another person (as the award of a debtor to his creditor); a surrender to a master

wait.n.02.definition: the act of waiting (remaining inactive in one place while expecting something)

equivocation.n.03.definition: falsification by means of vague or ambiguous language

take-in.n.01.definition: the act of taking in as by fooling or cheating or swindling someone

jugglery.n.01.definition: artful trickery designed to achieve an end

bluff.n.03.definition: the act of bluffing in poker; deception by a false show of confidence in the strength of your cards

wiretap.n.01.definition: the act of tapping a telephone or telegraph line to get information

collaboration.n.02.definition: act of cooperating traitorously with an enemy that is occupying your country

sophistication.n.05.definition: falsification by the use of sophistry; misleading by means of specious fallacies

delusion.n.03.definition: the act of deluding; deception by creating illusory ideas

trick.n.01.definition: a cunning or deceitful action or device

quackery.n.01.definition: medical practice and advice based on observation and experience in ignorance of scientific findings

spying.n.02.definition: the act of keeping a secret watch for intelligence purposes

confusion.n.05.definition: a mistake that results from taking one thing to be another

bribery.n.01.definition: the practice of offering something (usually money) in order to gain an illicit advantage

logrolling.n.01.definition: act of exchanging favors for mutual gain; especially trading of influence or votes among legislators to gain passage of certain projects

collision.n.03.definition: a conflict of opposed ideas or attitudes or goals

contrast.n.02.definition: the act of distinguishing by comparing differences

dissent.n.01.definition: (law) the difference of one judge's opinion from that of the majority

discord.n.02.definition: disagreement among those expected to cooperate

salaam.n.01.definition: a deep bow; a Muslim form of salutation

derivation.n.04.definition: (descriptive linguistics) the process whereby new words are formed from existing words or bases by affixation

feint.n.01.definition: any distracting or deceptive maneuver (as a mock attack)
